CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This is a much broader absorption than other reported random terpolymers , 23,24 endowing a great potential for improving the PSC performance and providing an ideal system for studying the compositional effect of the random terpolymers on the PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| other reported random terpolymers |
| the random terpolymers |
| the PSC (perovskite solar cell) performance |

In this paragraph, the "Material Name" entities refer to:

1. "other reported random terpolymers" - This term is referring to a class of materials that are terpolymers, which are polymers made up of three different monomers.
2. "the random terpolymers" - This term is also referring to a class of materials that are terpolymers, but in this context, it is a more general reference to terpolymers.
3. "the PSC (perovskite solar cell) performance" - This term is referring to the performance of a specific type of solar cell, the perovskite solar cell, which is a type of solar cell that has a perovskite-structured compound as the light-harvesting active layer.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| random terpolymers |

In this paragraph, the "Material Name" entities refer to:

1. "random terpolymers" - This term is referring to a class of materials that are terpolymers, which are polymers made up of three different monomers.

I apologize for the confusion in my previous response. I see that the other entities I had identified as "Material Name" entities are not actually referring to specific materials, but rather to the performance of a material (PSC) and a comparison to other materials (other reported random terpolymers).

Thank you for bringing this to my attention, and I will strive to be more precise in my future responses.
